Great news coming to this version!

Yes, MusicHarbor has reached version 2.0! To celebrate in style, we are launching a new feature called News. Now you can see the latest news from artists you follow and the top highlights from the music industry. You can also choose which sources to get the news from (right from the Settings tab).

This version also brings a redesigned notification experience. Now each release will trigger a separate notification (which will be grouped by iOS). And you can press firmly on the notification to see the album artwork!

And, of course, a lot of bug were fixed, especially regarding the stability of the feed of releases.

Let me know what you think about this new version! If you like MusicHarbor, please leave a review on the App Store!

Thanks,
Marcos.

Hello everyone! That's probably one of the biggest updates to MusicHarbor since version 2.0, so, get ready for:

- iCloud Sync: yes! Now we'll automatically sync the artists you follow between your devices. You can also manage the sync by yourself by going to the Settings screen.

- Advanced features through In-App Purchase: MusicHarbor has been, and will always be, a free, unlimited app. You'll always be able to follow as many artists as you want and track their releases, latest news and concerts. And I'll always try to avoid ads in the app as much as I can, because they disrupt the experience and are often a threat to user privacy. So I've found a better way to generate income and help to finance the app development: specific, power-user features that are available through In-App Purchase. For this release I've prepared two very useful features, which are:

- Permanently filter releases by type: this is an optional purchase that allows you to permanently filter the releases shown in the Releases tab, as well as in notifications.

- Customize formatting: this is an optional purchase that allows you to customize how releases are displayed in the Releases tab. You can choose whether to see the album or the artist name first. You can also change how dates are formatted (relative or absolute) throughout the app.

- Unlock everything: Unlock everything is a one-time purchase that unlocks all (current and future) paid features. With this purchase you'll be supporting the development of new features like custom icons, themes, news and concert notifications and more!

- And finally, this release contains a lot of minor UI improvements.

Thank you so much for using MusicHarbor!
Marcos.

A lot of new features and bug fixes in this update, thanks to the awesome feedback you guys have sent:

NEW FEATURES:

- Now it's possible to mark all releases as read. Alongside with the option to only see unread releases, this enables a whole new way of managing new releases on MusicHarbor!

- Added a new customization option to choose between two different sort options: by release date or by the date the album was found by MusicHarbor.

- Now it's possible to open the artist profile directly from a concert lineup.

- The Upcoming Music widget will now open on MusicHarbor the selected album.

BUG FIXES:

- Fixed a crash that occurred on the Artists tab, when performing an action with an artist while the search bar was active.

- Fixed an issue that could cause a previously paused preview to start playing when the app returned to the foreground.

- Fixed an issue that caused the search bar on the Add Artists screen to be misplaced when returning from the artist profile.

If you have a feature request or bug report, please send it to me via email or Twitter. And don't forget to rate and review MusicHarbor on the App Store!

Thanks!
Marcos.

This version contains a complete redesign of the artist profile! Now it’s possible to interactively filter the artist’s releases by type. It also works better with iPadOS in different Split View and slide over configurations.

There’s also a complete redesign of the News functionality! It now uses Google News as the engine, so you’ll get more accurate, up-to-date news from many more artists than before. I’ve also integrated it directly into the artist’s profile, so it’s easier to find and use. You can also long press on any release to quickly access news from that artist.

There’s also a complete redesign of the News functionality! It now uses Google News as the engine, so you’ll get more accurate, up-to-date news from many more artists than before. I’ve also integrated it directly into the artist’s profile, so it’s easier to find and use. You can also long press on any release to quickly access news from that artist.

And finally, the option to mark all releases as read it’s more visible in the Releases feed. You can access it from the left icon on the navigation bar.
